author: Truth Seeker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2018
review_content: GearLight, asked me to review this light and share my thoughts. Right out of the box, I was impressed. This light is solid in construction and seems well made. One feature of this light, which I really like, is the auto return to high beam after it is has been off for twenty seconds. No matter which mode you were in when you turn it off, it always comes on in high beam. Switching to the other modes is easy.There is no reference as to the lumens out put, so I wrote customer service and they told me, that this light is rated at 1040 Lumens. In actual use,  it is closer to 300 to 800 lumens, depending on the batteries you are using. I installed  AAA Alkaline batteries. (3) required. They give more than enough power to light up your world. You can also use rechargeable NiMH  (Nickel- Metal Hydride) batteries. If your looking for maximum power out put, you can also use a 18650 Lithium-ion rechargeable battery. The light comes with a plastic tube for this purpose.I played with the variable focus and it works great. Set at flood mode, I lit up the side of my barn at 70 yards. These high power flash lights are not toys. You can never look directly into the beam. At 300 lumens they are intense. At full power, they are blinding. You can damage your eyes. If you have small children, they must never be allowed the play with this flash light.As with any high power LED light, they will get hot after long run time. This is normal and will not harm the light.  GearLight offers a one year warranty for this light. It is iron clad. If anything goes wrong, they will take care of it.  Considering the modest price, and 2 lights are included, and my first contact with customer service, convinced me, that this light deserves 5 stars.
title: Good customer service

author: Alpine Doug
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
review_content: I was blindsided by the thousands of positive reviews, so without taking a critical look or reading carefully enough, I bought this light.  BIG MISTAKE!  Here are all the problems I have with it:o  The on/off button is ergonomically unusable.  The pictures show this light in someone's hands, with their thumb resting on the front of the light because that's the only place the switch could be to make this a functional tactical light.  WRONG.  The switch is on the rear end cap, making it impossible to turn on/off or select a light mode with just one hand.  If you're in a threatening situation, and it takes you two hands to control your flashlight, you're in big trouble.  You can use the switch with one hand, but only if you hold the light up next to your head, and press the button with your thumb.  That's ridiculous, IMO.o  The Amazon pic is misleading, and the description never says how big the light is.  From the picture, it looks like it's 10 to 12 inches long, and maybe 1.25 to 1.5 inches in dia.  Based on that flawed assumption, I naturally thought that this would take two "C" or "D" batteries.  WRONG AGAIN!  This light is tiny, measuring about 5 inches long, and 1 inch in dia. which causes it to have to use three AAA's that are loaded into a plastic holder.  I use a flashlight to walk my dogs, and I was going to use the strobe to scare away the neighbor's dog.  I seriously doubt that these batteries will last more than just a small handful of 30 minute walks at night.o  The light modes are goofy.  There are supposedly five, but there should only be three.  The bright light mode is good, and the beam is powerful.  That's the only good thing I can say about the light.  You can focus the beam, but not into a small spot.  At it's most intense focus, it projects about a 3' x 3' square of light at around 10'.  There's a "blurry" mode which I don't really understand, and another constant on mode whose purpose baffles me.  The strobe mode is OK, and the distress mode blinks out S-O-S in morse code.  OK.  That could come in handy if you're in a car wreck at night, and the distress signal doesn't wear out the small batteries.o  The lanyard is badly designed based on the on/off button being in back.  You can't reach it if the lanyard is around your wrist, at least not with my hands which are large.o  On the bright side, I give the carrying case 5 out of 5 stars.  If you want two great carrying cases for your unusable tactical light, and you're willing to pay this price for them, then this light is just the ticket.o  As with many Asian products, there are non-existent instructions included.  Maybe the light modes would be clearer to me if there was an explanation for them.  Maybe there's an explanation online, but based on the unusable on/off switch, I'm just not going to bother checking.I'm not going to return this item, because I feel stupid that I didn't read the details, and instead, I just believed all the reviews.  Don't make the same mistake.  But, if you've got smaller hands than mine, and you're only going to put this light in a glove compartment where it will hardly be used, then this might be a reasonable purchase.  NOT FOR ME!
title: I REGRET THIS PURCHASE - INADEQUATE AS A TACTICAL OR SECURITY LIGHT!!!

author: Randall C K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2018
review_content: Great little light!  Small enough  to fit in a pocket, but the output is almost as bright as a flashlight three times its size. Variable beam is width is great, allowing you to quickly go from a wide beam to spot light.  The holster is well made, but not something I use, since the light fits if a pocket so easily.  Battery life is comparable with the other three AAA cell LED flashlights I have owned.  I'll probably buy more of these, if they stand up to a couple months of use.

author: Tony
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2019
review_content: I took my son car camping for a few days and needed a pair of flashlights, a pair of lanterns, and a head-light for the trip.  When I assembled my lighting gear I decided that the cheapo LED flashlights I had needed an upgrade and were only suitable as back-ups.  I went found the pair of GearLight tactical flashlights on Amazon and decided to try them after reading both positive and negative reviews.I was very happy with the results!  This is a great flashlight for a casual camping trip.  We had no problems seeing our way along the paths of the camping grounds and our campsite.  The narrow beam can illuminate trees 100 feet away easily.A month later, the whole family went on another trip and spent a morning walking through a lava tube cave that extended nearly a mile underground.  The height of the cave varied from 5 feet to 45 feet and the width from 3 feet across to 20 feet across.  For fun, our group would stop in larger sections and turn off all of our flashlights for a minute.  It was absolutely pitch black!  With flashlights on, the wide beam was great for seeing your step forward and the walls of the cave.  The narrow high beam was good for illuminating the highest cave ceiling.We were in there for well over an hour.  I hadn't changed the AAA batteries (separately purchased Amazon brand) since I first opened the new package of flashlights.  By the very end of the cave hike, the brightness was fading.  But the light was still better than the cheaper LED lights and the headlights that some others in our party had.  Just time to replace the batteries.I will note that the park rented super high beam spotlights that looked like 3 inch by 3 inch blocks with handles attached.  The little GearLights were NOT anywhere as powerful as those spotlights.  But I did not expect them to be.At this price for two flashlights ($16 for the pair),  this is a solid piece of gear.
title: Great light for casual camping and vacationing

author: KimmyBird
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2019
review_content: Bought this 2-pack flashlights for 80+ year old parents.  The five (5) modes operation made no sense to someone who has known how to use a flashlight since the 1940.  I sort of presumed that the different modes were optional, such as a setting or switch.  Unfortunately, one must cycle through all modes to return to the brightest beam.  It doesn't really matter whether you can cycle through with soft touch, or click on then off repeatedly.While some of these generic flashlights claim their's has memory to retain the last used mode, this brand does not have this capability.  It will always turn on to the next mode in the cycle.  Seems astonishing these lights have so many great reviews, and do not see what makes this a "tactical" flashlight.  This was a deal breaker for octogenarians who already know how to use a flashlight.  Giving 2 stars because the LED is brighter than their old lights.  Returning these and have already replaced with simple easy-to-use MagLites.

author: Uncle Jimmy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2019
review_content: This same basic style of flashlight is available under about a dozen different brands, the only obvious difference is the color of the tail switch (blue, red, green, etc). This is one of the better ones. I have a similar light from PeakPlus which is a little better quality, but it's also about twice as expensive. This is basically two for the same price as one PeakPlus, and they're almost as good, just not quite as bright. Honestly, at a certain point, how bright a light do you really need? If you legitimately need an ultra-bright long-range light, you'll have to buy an actual spotlight anyway. This light is excellent as an emergency light to keep in your car for nighttime tire changes, etc., or a backup flashlight when the power goes out. It's not a true "tactical" flashlight, in that the body is too large to attach to most weapon mounts, and the focusing head is so easily moveable that you can't lock in a certain width of the light beam, and it's too big to be easy to stick in your pocket. It does come with a velcro holster for each light, which is nice.Overall, you're not likely to find a light this bright, at this quality, for a better price. Better lights are out there, but you'll pay at least twice as much for them.

author: Amazon Customer J.C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
review_content: I have purchased several of the smaller, 1 battery, versions of this flashlight.  When I decided to go for a 2-pack of the larger, three battery model for more power and versatility, a hard lesson was learned.  I got one that we could make work after an hour of playing with the batteries and NEVER got the other to work.  Every battery for every device I've ever owned was installed with the negative (flat) pole facing the spring and the positive (little bump) against a flat contact.  This unit has three batteries and after much futile experimenting got one to work by installing them all backwards (bump on battery to spring in unit).  The other one never worked whatever combination of polarities we tried.  The best explanation is that an untrained, illiterate, underpaid, third-world-country simply glued in the connections incorrectly and the factory obviously doesn't verify they work prior to shipping.  By the time we realized we couldn't get the second one to work at all, we had already disposed of the return shipping packaging.  So, basically, we have one unit that no one will ever remember how to install the batteries in the future and one that never worked at all with no way to return them.  That's what happens when I get lazy and use Bozo's company instead of just driving down the street,paying another couple of bucks (or sometimes even less), keeping local folks employed, and can verify the quality and effectiveness of the product I'm buying.  These are worthless at any price because of my wasted time, money and frustration and the fact that they don't work!

review_content: Alright this is an update to an earlier review I had made. author: Mike V., Albuquerque, NM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020
review_content: I ordered this item after reading a review resulting from a Google search for "Best Flashlight 2020". The review was written by a team who  tested this product and several other brand names that were getting five star reviews on Amazon.  This item was currently rated with four stars. There were pages and pages of reviews for this category and I had to sort thru them to find a review that I deemed to be honest and reliable. I read several reviews who did not pick this flashlight for best of the year, but this review was logical, well written, and non-byassed, and it caught my attention because the others seemed to go by brand names rather than performance.I wondered why this particular light was picked for the #1 spot, since there appeared to be better, more expensive flashlights on Amazon, rated with more stars. My first tactical flashlight was a Caterpillar. It was a gift from a friend, and it was extremely bright but got very hot, and the batteries lasted only a couple of hours before I had to recharge it. Needless to say, I was now hooked on the new LED technology and how bright these small handheld flashlights were these days. I am old school. The flashlights I remember were bulky, required large D cell or C cell batteries, and you needed an army of them to do the job that just one of these new age flashlights can do. They just were not as efficient as the lights being sold today.So, I purchased an Anker LC90 rechargeable thru Amazon next to try and find a better product that did not get as hot with longer lasting battery life and while I waited for its arrival, started to read reviews outside of Amazon. That's when I stumbled on this item.Why did this cheaper flashlight, a lesser rated item thru Amazon, get picked for the #1 spot thru a credible team of testers?After wrestling with my conscience, I finally convinced myself to order this item from Amazon, and I am glad I listened to my inner instinct.Both the items (the Anker and this item) arrived within a day of each other.  This one arrived even before the Anker which was days late (although that was the fault of UPS and not the manufacturer). When the Anker arrived, I was finally able to make the comparison.First off, this item delivered TWO flashlights. The other supposedly better, more expensive flashlight only included one. Secondly, this not only cost less and included two, but it produced a brighter light (my vision is poor, so the difference was immediately noticable). Lastly, the quality of this item ranks right up there and seems to be the same quality as the more expensive Anker.I must add that I was not grieved for already purchasing the more expensive flashlight that only included one item because this gave me the advantage of having the more expensive flashlight as a sort of base in which to hold as a standard to compare with.I can now see why the #1 spot for "Best Flashlight 2020" was awarded to this flashlight by that team of reviewers, and I would purchase this flashlight again if I were ever to lose the one I have.I am a very happy, satisfied customer. It paid off to do my homework and to read reviews outside of Amazon.Mike V.Albuquerque, NM

author: epact
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2017
review_content: This is a really great INDOOR household flashlight but a horrible OUTDOOR flashlight. Despite what the seller says, this is not a 1,000 lumen flashlight when used in the normal mode. The 1,000 lumen mode is available only when you narrow the beam, which is not very useful outdoors. Outdoors in normal mode (the only practical way to use it outdoors), the wide beam will light the path directly in front of your feet and at about 30 feet it turns into a feint blue haze. You can barely see what might be lurking around the dark corner with this so if you're going hiking, biking or walking or working at night outdoors buy a proper flashlight which is in the higher price-range and will be much larger than this. This seems to be a high-quality construction flash light with an all-metal construction and nice weight to it. It's nice to hold in your hands. I have one for the car and one for indoors. You will need three triple-A batteries per flashlight. I'm not sure how long they last, though.

author: E. Waldorph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020
review_content: I received the flashlights yesterday. Here is my first impression.Is the product worth the money? Yes. Does the product have value? Yes. In fact, these flashlights are undervalued.The flashlight itself shows outstanding American craftsmanship and I will expect this to last a very, very long time. It is well engineered, well made and certainly functional. The most likely point of failure is the zoom mechanism. (see below.) However the only test will be time and there is no indication it will fail for a very long time. The switch mechanism, the only other failure point, also shows no weakness.It comes with adapters for either a single rechargeable lithium battery or three AAA size standard or rechargeables.That's the good news.The bad news? The optics of the light are crap. Sort of defeats the entire purpose, eh?If the purpose of the light were to project an image of the LED at a distance, this product would be a 100% success. It is serviceable as a general area light and illuminates an average sized room or an average campsite well—a warehouse or arena would be another matter.The lens is plastic—to be expected at this price point. It is fairly well protected by the case. This brings up the focusing mechanism—the need for this is debatable. The beam is adjustable from flood to spot. It is based on the lens rather than the reflector. My service light is a Streamlight and is not adjustable. In fact, most "tactical" lights are not adjustable.Should you buy this light? For this price, that is almost a ridiculous question and the answer is an equivocal yes. If you have need to search for perps or prey and your life or others are dependent on lighting the scary dark, put up the dough and buy another light made for the purpose. But buy this one, too. If you aren't out nightly risking your life, this light may be the only and best flashlight you will ever need—and will probably last for the rest of your life.

review_content: 6 month review. Bought a pair of these in Jan 2019. Price at the time was around $17/pair. Nicely packaged and surprised it came with 2 carry pouches - nice. author: Roger Hofer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018
review_content: These new magic sticks of intense cool light we call flashlights are really amazing nowadays.  For $8 each you can have a pair of tiny flashlights that have a blinding bright true white, take a single lithium battery (or 3 AAA), can be focused or defocused, and are built like tanks!  Compare that to the past and I shutter.3/2020 - Well, I knocked off one star because eventually, BOTH units started to switch off and on and between lighting modes by simply shaking the body.  In fact, moving the body quite normally with the 16850 installed (with plastic fitting sleeve) resulted in the light switch on, off, and among the other modes.  I was about ready to throw them both away but figured I should at least try a contact cleaner on the screw-on back battery post.  Using a product called DetoxIT, I found the battery contact, as well as the aluminum threads, were very dirty.  These flashlights were not even brought outside once either, so I guarantee you WILL need to clean the contacts and threads if you intend to use these past the first-year honeymoon period.  Actually, the contacts should be gold-plated, but this was a corner they understandably cut.  I guarantee that 99% of the people writing these reviews judged their flashlights in the first year or two before the contacts become too dirty for reliable use.8/2020 - I'm taking off one more stars.  The cleaning did not last more than a few months, and the flashlights started to change modes again with shaking.  I use a 18650 battery, and I think I found out the problem: it seems a slight intend of the positive terminal and minor tarnishing of the battery is causing lose contact with the battery.  The problem I have with that is that I've used those batters for many years, and it is not uncommon for them to have some degree of denting in the positive terminal after a while (in fact the flashlight itself might be making the dent).  No other device (ex. my vape) has a problem with the positive terminal not being absolutely perfectly brand new, so this flashlight shouldn't either.  I cleaned the positive battery terminal with DetoxIT, and the flashlight works even with the very slight dent on the positive terminal.  Look they need to put in either better springs, a better positive contact, or something else entirely so the flashlight is not so hypersensitive to stuff like this.  I should not have to specially clean my batteries and the flashlight contacts inside to get it to work.  A simple gold coating on the battery contacts (like other devices often have) would fix all this, but they were too cheap to put it on there.  I'd suggest raising the price of the flashlight by 50 cents to coat the contacts with gold like everyone else does!
title: Little hard to believe how far flashlights have gone but you MUST clean the contacts sometimes

author: Jerrbear
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2018
review_content: There are a lot of clones of this kind of light floating around out there, but the price and features of this one made it particularly attractive. I have another similar flashlight that's a bit brighter than this one, but the zoom function is stiff and jerky, and if anything, for my purposes (searching through our video discs during the evening) it is actually too bright.Here are the things I like about this flashlight. First, it is compatible with a single BRC 18650 rechargeable battery.  Though it comes with a module that you can load three triple-As into, I just tossed out three other LED flashlights that I loved because just such modules were producing nothing but frustration for me as they failed to provide power when I needed it. Think about it...Instead of two connections on a single battery, you have eight aging, corroding connections, and if the path is interrupted at any point, a satisfying beam of light is replaced by an oath in darkness when the switch is depressed.OK, that was the major factor that motivated my purchase. The other things; the SOS flash and the strobe feature are fun, but probably have little practical use in my setting. Too small to be used as a club, it might provide significant reinforcement to a fist, or hit 'em in the face with the crenelated ring surrounding the lens. That edge is like a cookie cutter! The beam is very bright, and directed into the eyes of a predator lurking in a dark place would likely blind them long enough for you to get a good head start making your getaway if you're quick.The compactness makes it handy to carry in pocket or purse so you have a real, powerful flashlight, not a puny little pen light.  The hole in the butt end where the lanyard mounts could also be used to attach a chain if you wanted to hang it in some handy spot.  I cannot speak to the durability of the light at this point, but the body is metal, the battery compartment unscrews and reattaches easily, and the item feels good in my hands; well made.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
review_content: First, about  the flashlight:It's small, and very bright.  I bought it to replace a 4-D cell Maglite that wasn't working. author: Kiwi Kidd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2019
review_content: This is the second or third time I've purchased these sturdy little lights.  I don't keep losing the ones I've previously bought, I just keep finding more places I want them for safety reasons.  (Car, kitchen, bedside table, emergency kit, overnight bag, desk area, work tote, etc.)  I love the small size, the different flashing modes and brightness levels, and how compact they really are. title: Excellent for Emergency Kits!  And Cars!  And Bedside Tables! And....

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020
review_content: I got this flashlight because I work the closing shift pushing shopping carts and the parking lot has poor lighting. First off, after comparing the brightness to my 600 lumen Walmart flashlight I estimate the brightness is only about 400 lumens. The floodlight setting easily lights a circle of ground about 6 feet in diameter and has a max range of about 10 feet which is perfect for inspecting carts for garbage. The floodlight setting has a effective max range of about 100 feet which is perfect for spotting shopping carts from across the lot. However I knocked off one star because the spotlight setting causes shadows to appear in the light which can be very annoying. Thirdly, the strobe light setting is perfect for alerting vehicles to your presence. If you want a brighter flashlight then get ready to pay a premium because you wont find one for this price.

author: USMC15
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: Ordered this pair of GearLight Tactical, 5-Mode flashlights back on Nov 20 for an upcoming birthday gift for someone, and finally opened the package this morning. author: Barbara L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2019
review_content: Got a pair of these for about $18 because you can't have enough flashlights.  This is a good size for glove compartment, night stand drawer, or tool box. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2020
review_content: The previous version, bought last year or the year before was an excellent flashlight. author: Moses
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020
review_content: I did some testing and this flash light draw about:1500ma on high (4.2v)1000ma on high (3.7v no difference in brightness)750ma on medium (4.2v)330ma on low (4 2v)Which means:With 3400mah lithium-ion battery this is the battry life:3400mah/1.5amp= 2hours3400mah/700ma= 5hours3400mah/330ma= 10.3hoursBattery life on 3.7v Lithium-ion battery:2 hours on Low mode5 hours on Medium mode10 hours on High modeWith 3 aaa batteries you get much higher voltage then the flashlight required which means alot of it gonna be wasted on heat dissipates without giving you any extra brightnessWith Lithium-ion the flash light still wasting alot of energy for heat dissipation but less then with aaa batterySo Lithium-ion should be the most efficient power source for this flash light!Which means less of the batt energy will be wasted.Features wise:The zoom gives you the option to concentrate the light on farther object or get more out of it with dying batteryThe aluminum gives it a good feel in the handThe price let you using it anywhere you want without the worries of loosing/breaking itIt's a nice flashlight with alot of flexibilityAnd with all the accessories comes with itThis is definitely worth it's price. 🔦November-4-20201 if the flashlight lens just fell offI emailed the customer service and 10min later they have a brand new replacement shipped to meSo tgis is definitely 5stars!!!

author: Harry H. Matthews
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2017
review_content: Great little flashlight with a big heart! I was amazed the first time I turned this flashlight on as it seemed brighter than any other flashlight I had ever owned. author: Peter O.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_content: Light has a nice warm white output in the mid hundred range, Its a similar brightness to the HF Quantum 588 lumen run on a rechargeable, but can accommodate a 650 length cell vs 500 for the HF. LED is unmarked except for GK.Battery drain is conservative at ~1.4A on a fresh charge 20650, an hour run time pulls a 3350mAh cell down to 3.8V. I'd estimate 4-5 hours or usable brightness on high before needing to recharge. Incidentally the Quantum 588 lumen draws 3A.This is a more conservative power draw than the cheaper T6 multi-packs elsewhere on Amazon or EB that draw 1.6A with less light output. Light also doesn't heat up as much as the cheaper units.Tube interior diameter is 23.2mm so will accommodate 18650 or 20650 cells flat or button top since there's a spring on the + terminal. The manufacturer stresses the need to use a protected cell as their products are directly driven and can use rechargeable or alkaline batteries with the included carrier, plastic battery spacer tube also included for 18650's .The LED retainer appears to be anodized aluminum not cheap plastic as on other lights. The rest of the light uses a better quality of materials than the cheaper T6 multi packs do.Comes with a nicely made carry pouch with belt loop.Excellent customer service and warranty

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
review_content: I like the small size-fits perfectly in my hand and has terrific lighting capability.  I bought the charger too.  Everything worked fine but they do not supply the adapter you need to plug into a socket.  Fortunately the adapter for my cell phone fit.  Otherwise perfect.  I am going to buy two more of these flashlights.
title: small hand held

author: Therin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
review_content: I can only speak to water resistance and battery life from product advertising. I have not had it long enough to truly test it. However, I can speak to its brightness and adjustability, which are very satisfactory. I will keep one at my bedside and the other in the car. I antipode them being very useful.
title: GearLight

author: Shane G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: I really like these flashlights for the price point and size they are.  They seem to be pretty durable and are very bright for only taking 3 triple A batteries.  I can't speak to battery life or how water resistant they are since I haven't used them in water and have only had them a couple days.  but so far they are great and well-deserving of a 5 star review!
title: It's very bright and seems very durable

author: Sarah G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
review_content: Was showing the husband my new, bright flashlight and he ask if I got him one.  I sure did, hunny! 😆 😆So far both work great!  It replaced a similar name brand one that I loved (and left outside) but can't find another like it.  Nice little lights & I love a good price 😉
title: Great little lights!

author: AnneLM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
review_content: Now that I have two, I can keep one in my home office and one in the bedroom as needed.  They are strong, heavy-duty material and I really like the carry case, so I can pop in my handbag when I travel or when needed.  Excellent and BRIGHT light indeed.  Like the 5 features, zooming, etc.  You will not go wrong.  I highly recommend.
title: Small package, but packs power!

author: wdave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2019
review_content: I tested 3 different tactical flashlights.  This is the only one that felt like i wouldn't tear my hand to shreds if i actually hit someone with it.  Way heavier, well made, bright, better priced than the rest of the others.  I bought 2 x 2 packs my wife and 2 daughters and i all have one they are all still working perfectly after a year.  I feel better with my girls walking to the buss stop with one in their hands.  Far superior to all the other flashlights, if you are struggling - this is the one to buy
title: Actually comfortable in your hand

author: Sgreen219
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019
review_content: Package arrived in good shape and fast delivery.  Light output is great.  Not sure about battery life yet as I have only tested them, but they are in our hunting packs and will see use in the next week.  I will report if anything stands out one way or the other but for the price point, they exceed my expectations in fit and finish.  The mode and on/off button takes getting used to.
title: Bright and Compact.  Nice light.

author: DRH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020
review_content: The flashlights meet my expectations. I cannot speak to the battery life or the water resistance. The tubes for extra battery storage absolutely do not work and a total waste. It is very difficult to switch to the different modes (strobe, etc.) by pressing the same button as the power button. This function is not important to me.
title: They’re fine.

author: Ryan Seth Jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020
review_content: I love how compact this flashlight is! Amazed at how many features this light has, it literally does whatever I need in any situation. It is powerful and bright considering it uses three AAA batteries. A real must have for anyone looking for a small but bright LED flashlight.
title: Small compact flashlight with bright LED

author: M. Hughes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: Lightweight and inexpensive. I have them stashed everywhere so I never have to search for a flashlight or wish I had one in my car.  These are perfect to put in drawers, closets or the glovebox.  Small enough to carry in a pocket or purse.  Battery life seems to be good.  Not as much light as my Maglight but not as heavy or cumbersome. Love 'em.
title: I have them in every room and in the car

author: matthew wade
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2019
review_content: These flaslights are exactly what I needed.  Not only do they come with 2 flashlights, but they are bright as HECK, come with sheaths for mounting on a belt or molle, and have a "SOS" function which you never know when it could come in handy.  I would not hesitant in buying these again and recommend them to anyone in need of a small yet bright flashlight with a tactical look.  They take AAA batteries as well.
title: Bang for your buck, very bright, perfect!

author: Donna A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: I have only had this product for a couple of weeks so I can't speak to battery life or water resistance. I mostly use it to walk my dog. I really like the size (not too big) as well as the attached wrist cord. I also like the ability to enlarge the beam or make it smaller depending on what I'm doing. My old flashlight had a small beam but this one allows to to see where I'm walking so that I can avoid cracked sidewalks etc. I'm very happy with my purchase.
title: Good Size Bright Light

author: Jess Cook
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019
review_content: The product is brand new so I can't comment as to durability or battery life.  The light functions are effective and bright.  The carry pouch is a nice feature.Having to cycle on and off through all functions to select the one you want is inconvenient and certainly not "tactical".  At minimum, the strobe function should have a separate switch.
title: Poor Switching

author: VF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
review_content: Love these handy flashlights. The quality of these flashlights are very well-made easy to handle and I like that they are small you can put one in your purse set it on the counter use it out in the garage.I think everyone would enjoy a flashlight like this.
title: Love these handy flashlights

author: Paul
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
review_content: Very bright flash light very portable takes AAA batteries so no need for special a battery I can't comment on battery life as I have only had this light for a week these lights have a strobe feature which I have not had any occasion to use but so far very impressed with this light I would recomend this product to anyone needing a small and very bright light
title: Vwey Bright

author: Eagle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: Nice little flashlight. Not sure why it had to be designed to take 3. AAA batteries, I think a single C battery or two C batteries would have worked fine. Other than that nice little flashlight. Very bright
title: Nice bright flashlight

author: Denise R. Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2019
review_content: This flashlight is super bright but is a battery eater. We use to take our dog out at night and battery only lasts about 8 days!!!
title: eats batteries!!

author: R.C. Hope
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020
review_content: This battery is perfect for my car. Super bright and fits in my hand. I had an auto accident last week in the dark and my other manufacturers battery was weak. Now I have a flashlight that lights up an entire area! Thank you for making an affordable bright light.
title: Bright light that fits comfortably in hand

author: SenoraDarkness
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
review_content: Good flashlight for doing my counts at night.  (I work at a prison).  The only thing i do not like is that I have to cycle through all of the settings to get to the setting I want which is the low setting.  I wish there was a memory within that would save my last setting so I wouldn't have to do that.  Other than that, it's still a good flashlight.  Only time will tell to see how durable it is.And I have only tried one of them.  Maybe it's a fluke and the other flashlight does have a working memory...
title: So far so good

author: Dutch J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020
review_content: Love our GearLight LED tactical flashlights.  The lights are so bright and love that we can adjust the circle of light.  They also come with a flashlight pouch you can put on a belt. It is so easy to insert batteries. I would recommend this flashlight to anyone.
title: Easy to use and operate

author: Amyth4
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
review_content: Light is easy to use, but took a bit to get the battery in one lined up... the lumens are not nearly as bright as i had hoped they would be. They are small and seem to be well built otherwise. However, for use as a tactical light, they would not be the best. Go for brighter if you can.
title: Not so bright but easy to use

author: davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: Use these for all sorts of tasks. Working under the car, power outages, walking the dog. Plenty of brightness, adjustable beam, multiple modes. I highly recommend you buy some rechargable 18650 cells (make sure they include a protection circuit!!) and use the included adapter with them!
title: Excellent flashlights

author: Richard Buchborn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2020
review_content: We live on the out skirts of Houston and love being away from the city lights, you know "The stars at night are big and bright....but occasionally the wife get nervous in the darkness's. This light allows her to gather her courage. Excellent wide lens and good distance on the narrow focus. Excellent. Love it.
title: Love It

author: Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2020
review_content: I bought this after tornadoes hit close to our area a few months ago. Ended up helping a friend move stuff out of a house that had been totaled by the tornado. Worked great even with no other ambient light available.My friend had 2 $100+ tactical lights he was using, and he asked me how much mine cost. I told him $17, and he was floored how good mine were.Will absolutely buy more in the future.
title: Great light for cheap, can compete with more expensive lights

author: Fred D. Tyner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
review_content: I was expecting something a little bigger - these are itsy bitsy.  I guess they're OK in a pinch and they certainly don't take up much room in a drawer but they're maybe 5-6 inches long.  I'm gonna leave them around the house in case of a power outage - keep me from stumbling around in the dark.  If you're looking for a real flashlight - keep looking.
title: So, pay attention

author: HeyoPrinsen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: This is exactly what I was looking for! It's really bright and the battery seems to last pretty long. It also gives you two options on what to power it with. It comes with an adapter for 3 AAA batteries or one big battery that I don't know the name of. I opted for the big battery. Works great
title: Awesome flash light!

author: ,HollyL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020
review_content: These flashlights are so bright! Overall they work excellent, until one night they are left out in the rain and now there is condensation inside the lens of the flashlight. It still works but now it isn't as bright as it was and is like the other flashlights we have. We use this mainly to check the tree line behind our house at night (about 80'-100' from our porch) before we let the dogs out.
title: Great BUT

author: Marley Redlin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2019
review_content: The flashlight is very adequate. Don't get me wrong they work well - I was just expecting a light up the heavens and earth flashlight but it fell short of those expectations! The light comes with battery holders but no batteries of any kind. I assumed it came with the rechargeable batteries and the holder for Alkaline batteries but alas...No batteries at all. One of the lights I ordered did not work but I contacted them and they shipped a new one immediately and required no return of the non-working unit. Overall - Well worth the price and quality.
title: Great Customer Care

author: Catherine J Dorgan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
review_content: Lived up to it's expectations. Strobe is great, the light is very bright, and it is small and easy to carry. I bought it because we have a very large resident black bear in our area that frequently passes through our yard.  He does not care about noise--I've tried banging pots and pans, etc. to no avail. But I found out that they don't like bright or strobe lights, so I will carry this with me when performed yard tasks!
title: Very happy with this flashlight!

author: Jeri Lynn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
review_content: These flashlights are a little shorter than I thought, 5 inches in length. However, Light is quite powerful as advertised. I've decided to give the pair as gifts and order the larger 2000 lumens for myself in addition to another 2 for myself using the 30 percent discount card that came in the box. For the money with free prime shipping, it is a great buy IMO.
title: Brilliant

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
review_content: For the price it seems like a very sturdy flashlight. The beam is very bright and a plus is that the beam can be zoomed on for greater concentration of brightness. I'm only using the AAA battery option.. I have not tried the lithium battery option because I'm afraid of it possibly exploding. I have not had a chance to test it underwater but I'm hoping it holds up. Finally, having two flashlights is a plus. I would definitely buy this product again.
title: Excellent..performs as advertised

author: Becky S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020
review_content: Super bright once we got the 3 AAA batteries into the bottom end. We use these for walking the dog after dark, the small hand held size is convenient to carry without feeling heavy, and can stash into a pocket even if it sticks out a little. Worth the price so far.
title: Bright and Handy

author: J&J Andreason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
review_content: These flashlights are handy to have around. They are bright and compact. The batteries they come with didn't have a long life, but I do not consider that much or a problem. Haven't had to test them out in wet conditions, but if I do I will update the review to reflect their performance in such conditions.
title: Nice and Bright

author: Dori D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020
review_content: These are very bright and easy to hold.  I used one on flash to highlight my Halloween baskets since it was dark out. As a caregiver,  I use one daily to untangle an oxygen hose from under a wheelchair.  I need a very bright and focused light for that.  I have already bought two new ones since I depend on them for numerous jobs.  I like the small design since it makes it easier to hold.
title: Bright
